column4: anyone willing to help me with xorg? for some reason it decided today that it wont start and i can't figure out why. :(
more info please

it's a 2 weeks old dapper installation. i didn't install, update nor change anything before this happened. today the computer booted just fine, but about an hour ago while i was surfing away with firefox, xorg refused to start new programs so i decided to reboot. during next reboot i was greeted with shell prompt...
i would start with /var/log/Xorg.0.log
the most recent error in that log is "fatal server error: could not open default font 'fixed'"
paste your xorg.conf
Could not init font path element unix/:7100, removing from list!
thats not a problem
paste xorg.conf
paste the log and the conf file contents
here on this channel? they're alfully long...
now that i started looking at the xorg.conf, there's something wrong with the font paths
any idea what might have tampered with these? firefox and gaim were the only open programs at the time.
your update should have added the font lines
the apt-get update/upgrade you would've done
no, nope any programs, you need root perms to edit xorg.conf
i guess i'm lucky to have you on this channel and this spare PII 400MHz i'm currently on :). without these i'd be lost without a working xorg.conf i can compare.
no, the problem isn't in xorg.conf
i just compared a working xorg.conf with the one that is not working
i get these on my .xsession-errors: x-session-manager: symbol lookup error: /usr/lib/libgtk-x11-2.0.so.0: undefined
gtk seems to be broken, try to upgrade gtk+, pango, atk and glib2
how do i do that? apt-get update says there's nothing new. can i somehow force it to reinstall these?
